Package squidpony

Class ColoredStringList<T>

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<IColoredString<T>>
squidpony.ColoredStringList<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<IColoredString<T>>, java.util.Collection<IColoredString<T>>, java.util.List<IColoredString<T>>, java.util.RandomAccess
@Deprecated
public class ColoredStringList<T>
extends java.util.ArrayList<IColoredString<T>>
Deprecated.
This class duplicates the functionality of an ArrayList of IColoredString, and isn't very clear.
An helper class for code that deals with lists of IColoredStrings. It does nothing smart, its only purpose is to save you some typing for frequent calls.
This class is deprecated in favor of using standard JDK ArrayList<IColoredString<T>>, where T is usually Color from libGDX. Using ArrayList lets you build these using Maker.makeList(Object[]), if you want. Some of the methods in this class aren't very obvious for what they actually do; ArrayList.add(Object) will add a new line, while addText(String) will append text to the last line.
See Also:
Serialized Form
